title: Computer Vision and Machine Learning Research Scientist - Physiology

description: You’ll be working in a team of researchers and engineers to implement world class algorithms that push the state-of-the-art. This is a multi-faceted scientific role that will require you to be versatile across a variety of tasks in a highly collaborative environment. You will have the following responsibilities: Develop machine learning models to pull out meaningful and actionable insights from complex multimodal datasets. Work cross-functionally with other team members to translate these insights into transformative prototypes and demonstrations. Help architect and port closed-loop, real-time algorithms to a variety of platforms.
key_qualifications: Hands-on experience with applying both traditional CV models (for example: optical flow, structure from motion, state estimation, feature descriptors, Eulerian magnification) and deep learning models (for example: body/face detection, segmentation, stereo depth, saliency, recurrent and convolutional nets, transformers) on physiological datasets. Fluency in a high-level programming language (Python and/or Matlab) and experience with ML tools (scikit-learn, pandas and deep learning toolboxes such as TensorFlow and PyTorch). 2+ years experience with OpenCV or similar. 2+ years experience in signal processing, linear algebra and time-frequency analysis. Excellent programming, problem solving and debugging skills. Interest in applying machine learning techniques to help improve user’s wellbeing, health and comfort. PhD (or MS and 3 years of research experience) in Computer Science, Biomedical Engineering, Computational Neuroscience, Applied Mathematics, or related field.
preferred_qualifications: Experience with human visual system and perception. Experience with translating exploratory data analyses into production models. 2+ years industry research experience is a plus.
